summary: The Korematsu-Takai Civil Liberties Protection Act of 2025 aims to protect individuals in the United States from unlawful detention based solely on protected characteristics. The bill amends Title 18 of the United States Code to prohibit imprisonment or detention based on race, ethnicity, national origin, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any characteristic deemed protected by the Attorney General. The act also clarifies that the Attorney General cannot remove these specific characteristics from the protected definition.
